revision.comment: The show is not even the top local morning drive show, let alone national.
revision.text: '''Dave Mordal''' (pronounced like "more doll") is a [[comedian]] from [[Elk River, Minnesota]].{{cite news|url=http://www.republican-eagle.com/event/article/id/72221/ |title=Hansen and the Stagebenders will be performing in Lake City |date=February 21, 2011 |publisher=The Republican Eagle |accessdate=1 March 2011 }}{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web |url=http://tucson.com/entertainment/television/remote-controlled-wreckreation-nation-set-to-debut-tuesday/article_7a144395-5b9a-53fa-980d-0f3e17c1c770.html |title=Remote Controlled: 'Wreckreation Nation' set to debut Tuesday |newspaper=[[Arizona Daily Star]] |date= |author= |accessdate= December 6, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2003-09-07/news/0309070021_1_stand-up-teasing-comic |title=Despite outcome of reality show, trio still standing - tribunedigital-chicagotribune |newspaper=Articles.chicagotribune.com |date= 7 September 2003|author=Allan Johnson |accessdate= December 6, 2017}} == Career == He was a contestant on the first and third seasons of [[NBC]]'s ''[[Last Comic Standing]]'' where, as per the ''[[Arizona Daily Star]]'', he came to be "best known for his sarcastic humor as a battling comedian". In a July 2003 ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' report, Mordal shared his views about the show: "“Ten comics living in a house together. [...] It’s just going to be a matter of time before either everybody gets used to it or somebody snaps and kills somebody."{{cite web |url=http://people.com/archive/picks-and-pans-review-last-comic-standing-vol-60-no-2/feed/ |title=Picks and Pans Review: Last Comic Standing |newspaper=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date= 14 July 2003 |author= Mike Lipton|accessdate= December 6, 2017}} He was fourth eliminated in the first season after losing in a head-to-head competition to [[Dat Phan]], the eventual winner of Last Comic Standing season 1. He was first [[runner-up]] in the third season. On the show he was known for his great friendship with [[Rich Vos]], with whom he was seen taking baths and ironing. Also notable was the "infamous" rat hunt where Dave caught a rat. He also has made guest appearances on ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]''{{cite web |url=http://epguides.com/TonightShowwithJayLeno_1992/ |title=The Tonight Show with Jay Leno (a Guest Stars & Air Dates Guide) |newspaper=Epguides.com |date= |author= |accessdate= December 6, 2017}} and was in the 1999 movie ''Los Enchiladas'' as the bread delivery guy. Mordal was the host of ''[[Wreckreation Nation]]'', which first aired January 2009 on the [[Discovery Channel]].{{cite web |url=http://www.ign.com/tv/wreckreation-nation |title=Wreckreation Nation: Season 1 - TV - IGN |newspaper=Ign.com |date= |author= |accessdate= December 6, 2017}} A February 2009 ''[[The New York Times|New York Times]]'' report called Mordal "the intrepid star of "Wreckreation Nation,”..." additionally quoting a Nielsen report that said that the show had garnered an average viewership of 1.3 million.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/22/arts/television/22genz.html?pagewanted=all |title=‘Wreckreation Nation': Thrill of Victory, the Agony of the Host |newspaper=The New York Times |date= 18 February 2009 |author= Neil Genzlinger|accessdate= December 6, 2017}} While largely retired from his stand-up comedy career, he currently appears on-air weekdays as a personality on the morning-drive "The KQ Morning Show," on Minneapolis/St. Paul's [[KQRS-FM]] 92.5. == References == {{reflist}} {{Last Comic Standing 1}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mordal, Dave}} [[Category:American comedians]] [[Category:People from Elk River, Minnesota]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Last Comic Standing contestants]] {{US-comedian-stub}}
